Package data_structure

Class AcyclicGraph

java.lang.Object
data_structure.AcyclicGraph
Direct Known Subclasses:
DirectedAcyclicGraph, UndirectedAcyclicGraph
public abstract class AcyclicGraph extends Object
AcyclicGraph is to describe one kind of the graph abstract data structure.

This class represents graphs that have no cycles, thus a two-dimensional array can be used to store length of every edge.
It's implemented by two subclasses, UndirectedAcyclicGraph, DirectedAcyclicGraph.

Author:
Frank_Xiao

    • addEdge

      public abstract void addEdge(int start, int end, int length)
      Add an edge to the graph. If an edge already exists, it will be replaced by the new one.

      Depending on different kinds of the graph, it is implemented differently.

      Parameters:
      start - index of the start node
      end - index of the end node
      length - length of the edge

    • getEdgesStartWith

      public HashMap<Integer,Integer> getEdgesStartWith(int start)
      Find all edges starting from one node.
      Parameters:
      start - index of the starting node, an integer greater than 0
      Returns:
      a HashMap storing end node's index and its corresponding length
